Title: Streptoechites, a new genus of Asian Apocynaceae
Keywords:
Apocynaceae, Apocyneae, Aganonerion, Sindechites,
Cleghornia, Urceola, Epigynum, Templeton test, winning sites test
Abstract:
The new genus Streptoechites D.J.Middleton & Livsh. is
described and the new combination Streptoechites chinensis (Merr.)
D.J.Middleton & Livsh. is made. Analysis of chloroplast and nuclear
loci leaves uncertain its phylogenetic position within tribe Apocyneae,
but Templeton and winning sites tests reject with statistical
significance its inclusion in Sindechites, Epigynum, or Cleghornia, the
three genera where it has been previously classified. In contrast, the
monophyly of Urceola and Epigynum is neither supported nor rejected,
making any re-circumscription of these two genera premature. A close
relationship between Urceola and the monotypic genus Aganonerion,
sampled for the first time in a molecular analysis, is supported.
